Authors:
Rungtiwa Phookamsak, Hong-Bo Jiang, Nakarin Suwannarach,
Saisamorn Lumyong, Jianchu Xu, Sheng Xu, Chun-Fang Liao, Putarak
Chomnunti
Title:
Bambusicolous fungi in Pleosporales I: introducing four novel
taxa and a new habitat record for Anastomitrabeculia didymospora
Keywords:
Dothideomycetes, Paramultiseptospora bambusae gen. et sp.
nov., Pyrenochaetopsis yunnanensis sp. nov., Taxonomy, Tetraploa
bambusae sp. nov.
Abstract:
An ongoing research survey of bambusicolous fungi in
northern Thailand and southwestern China, several saprobic fungi were
collected from dead branches, culms and twigs of bamboos and
preliminarily identified as species in Pleosporales (Dothideomycetes)
based on a morphological approach. Multigene phylogenetic analyses
demonstrated four novel taxa belonging to the families
Anastomitrabeculiaceae, Parabambusicolaceae, Pyrenochaetopsidaceae and
Tetraploasphaeriaceae. Hence, Paramultiseptospora bambusae gen. et sp.
nov., Pyrenochaetopsis yunnanensis sp. nov. and Tetraploa bambusae sp.
nov. are introduced. In addition, Anastomitrabeculia didymospora was
found on bamboo twigs in terrestrial habitats for the first time and is
reported in this study. Detailed morphological descriptions and updated
phylogenetic trees of each family are provided.
